awd_titl_txt: U.S.-France Cooperative Research: The Representation        Theory of P-adic Groups
awd_abstract_narration: 9314473  Kutzko    This three-year award supports U.S.-France cooperative research  in algebra and number theory between Philip C. Kutzko, University  of Iowa, and Guy Henniart, University of Paris, Orsay.  The  investigators will study a number of problems related to  representation theory of p-adic groups and applications to  Langlands' program.  The Langlands' picture theorizes that  fundamental objects of arithmetic (elliptic curves) are connected  with fundamental objects in representation theory (classical  modular forms).  The U.S.investigator brings to this  collaboration expertise in the representation theory of p-adic  groups.  This is complemented by the French investigators renown  expertise in local Langlands conjecture.    This project will advance our understanding of representation  theory and will serve as a basis for future advances in number  theory and arithmetical algebraic geometry.  ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
